PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Non Limited Greater Than Three Millimeters

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Non Limited Greater Than Three Millimeters
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Restricted or in amount, size, or extent.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Restricted or in amount, size, or extent.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Limited to Less Than or Equal to Three Millimeters

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Limited to Less Than or Equal to Three Millimeters
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.: Restricted or in amount, size, or extent.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
Restricted or in amount, size, or extent.
